docs.lead_paragraph: The transfer is the first in nearly three months, and it reduces the inmate population to 154, part of an ongoing effort to close the facility.

headline.main: Military Repatriates Algerian Detainee From Guantánamo Bay
headline.print_headline: Military Repatriates Algerian Held for Years at Guantánamo

docs.abstract: Military announces it has repatriated Algerian detainee Ahmed Bin Saleh Bel Bacha, who has been held without trial for 12 years at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.
docs.snippet: The transfer is the first in nearly three months, and it reduces the inmate population to 154, part of an ongoing effort to close the facility.

docs.lead_paragraph: After six days of refusing food, the last four immigrants on a hunger strike at the Northwest Detention Center in Tacoma have eaten a little bit of food.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate has passed legislation to require child care providers who care for children from low-income families through a government voucher program to undergo criminal background checks, know first aid and CPR and get other training.

headline.main: Senate Bill Would Expand Child Care, Boost Safety
headline.print_headline: Senate Bill Would Expand Child Care, Boost Safety

docs.lead_paragraph: The global industry for halal food and lifestyle products — ones that meet Islamic law standards of manufacture — is estimated to be worth hundreds of billions of dollars and is multiplying as Muslim populations grow. Producers outside the Muslim world, from Brazil to the U.S. and Australia, are eager to tap into the market.

headline.main: Demand Grows for Halal Food as Industry Evolves
headline.print_headline: Demand Grows for Halal Food as Industry Evolves

docs.lead_paragraph: Larry Dee Scott, a trailblazing bodybuilder who rose to fame in the 1960s and became the first Mr. Olympia by winning the top international competition, has died at the age of 75.
